text: Vic Damone (born Vito Rocco Farinola; June 12, 1928 â€“ February 11, 2018) was an American traditional pop and big band singer-songwriter, actor, radio and television presenter, and entertainer. He was born in Brooklyn, New York. He was best known for his performances of songs such as "You're Breaking My Heart" (a number one hit), the number four hit "On the Street Where You Live" (from My Fair Lady), and "My Heart Cries for You" (also No. 4).
